SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.graphics.color

Class RichColor

java.lang.Object
civitas.celestis.math.vector.Vector4
civitas.celestis.graphics.color.RichColor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Vector, Serializable
public class RichColor extends Vector4
A color class with linear transition capability. Color components are stored using double with a range of 0-255
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    • TRANSLUCENT_THRESHOLD

      public static final double TRANSLUCENT_THRESHOLD
      Any value of alpha above this value will be considered opaque by the graphics engine. Higher values will be more realistic, while lower values will offer better performance
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • RichColor

      public RichColor(@Nonnull String hexString)
      Creates a new color. The hex string must be in the format #RRGGBB or RRGGBB.
      Parameters:
      hexString - The hex string to create this color from

    • RichColor

      public RichColor(@Nonnull String hexString, double alpha)
      Creates a new color. The hex string must be in the format #RRGGBB or RRGGBB. The alpha component must be within the range of 0-255.
      Parameters:
      hexString - The hex string to create this color from
      alpha - The alpha component of this color

    • RichColor

      public RichColor(int hexInt)
      Creates a new color. The hex integer must be in the format 0xRRGGBB.
      Parameters:
      hexInt - The hex code as an integer

    • RichColor

      public RichColor(int hexInt, double alpha)
      Creates a new color. The hex integer must be in the format 0xRRGGBB. The alpha component must be within the range of 0-255.
      Parameters:
      hexInt - The hex code as an integer
      alpha - The alpha component of this color

    • RichColor

      public RichColor(double r, double g, double b)
      Creates a new opaque color. The alpha will be 255. All parameters must be within the range of 0-255.
      Parameters:
      r - The red component of this color
      g - The green component of this color
      b - The blue component of this color

    • RichColor

      public RichColor(double r, double g, double b, double a)
      Creates a new color. All parameters must be within the range of 0-255.
      Parameters:
      r - The red component of this color
      g - The green component of this color
      b - The blue component of this color
      a - The alpha component of this color

    • RichColor

      public RichColor(@Nonnull Vector3 rgb, double a)
      Creates a new color. All parameters must be within the range of 0-255.
      Parameters:
      rgb - The RGB components of this color mapped in x, y, z respectively
      a - The alpha component of this color

    • RichColor

      public RichColor(@Nonnull double[] values)
      Creates a new color. All parameters must be within the range of 0-255.

    • equals

      public static boolean equals(@Nonnull RichColor c1, @Nonnull RichColor c2)
      Checks for equality between two colors while accounting for differences in decimal places. This rounds the RGBA components, then checks them for equality.
      Parameters:
      c1 - The first color to compare
      c2 - The second color to compare
      Returns:
      true if the colors are effectively equal

      Returns:

      c2 - The second color

      @Nonnull public final Color awtRaw()

      Returns:
      An AWT Color object

    • reflectiveness

      public double reflectiveness()
      Calculates the reflectiveness coefficient of this color. This is calculated by normalizing the sum of the RGB components, then multiplying it by the normalized alpha component.
      Returns:
      The reflectiveness coefficient of this color (0-1)

    • normalize

      @Nonnull public Vector4 normalize()
      Normalizes this color to fit within the range of 0-1. If the magnitude of this color is zero (the color is black and the alpha is zero), this will return Vector4.ZERO.
      Specified by:
      normalize in interface Vector
      Overrides:
      normalize in class Vector4
      Returns:
      The normalized vector representing the RGBA components of this color

    • proximity

      public double proximity(@Nonnull RichColor c)
      Returns the proximity index of this color and the provided color c. This is calculated by normalizing the squared distance of the two colors.

      An index of 0 means the colors are equal, while an index of 1 means that the colors are completely different. (most likely TRANSPARENT_BLACK and WHITE)

      Parameters:
      c - The color to compare to
      Returns:
      The proximity index of the two colors

    • parseColor

      @Nonnull public static RichColor parseColor(@Nonnull String input) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Deserializes a string into a RichColor.
      Parameters:
      input - The input to deserialize
      Returns:
      The parsed vector
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - When the format is invalid
      IllegalArgumentException - When at least one of the component scalars is non-finite
